New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns scored 31 points and had 21 rebounds, Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists, becoming the first Knicks player since 1981 with consecutive triple-doubles, and Hart has four triple-doubles this season, making him the fourth player with ten for the Knicks
Key Match Events: Deuce McBride was replaced by Cam Payne due to left hamstring tightness, and Payne contributed with eight points and nine assists, the game was close in the first half but the Knicks pulled away in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks added Karl-Anthony Towns and Josh Hart to reduce reliance on Jalen Brunson, and they managed to win without him, shooting 55% from the field
Post-Match Reflections: The Jazz struggled with Lauri Markkanen shooting just 6 for 22, and the Knicks won their ninth straight game, 14 of their last 16 games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks have a strong winning streak, key substitutions and player contributions
